intro: Parnassia maisorensis, commonly known as the Moreton Bay parnassia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its striking white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and swampy areas. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a distinctive veining pattern. Parnassia maisorensis plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
